title: Create CAR MODEL-has-prime-image-IMAGE Relationship
user_story:
As an API contributor\
I want to be able to select one IMAGE for a CAR MODEL to be used as prime image\
So the node has an ideal visual representation in any frontend application
description:
# Specification

* Requests are rejected with a `404` error when the CAR MODEL, the IMAGE or both don't exist.
* Requests are rejected with a `404` error when a node with the given ID actually exists, but does not have the correct type. The first node needs to be a CAR MODEL, the second an IMAGE.
* The relationship is successfully created when both nodes exist and are from the correct type. → Status code `201`.
  * A JSON object is returned confirming that both entities have been connected:
    * `car_model_id`: integer
    * `image_id`: integer
    * `relationship_id`: integer
    * `relationship_name`: string → `has-prime-image`
* The user can trigger the creation of the same relationship multiple times. The result is always the same:
  * same status code
  * same structure
  * same data
  * **same relationship ID**
  * ⚠️ The relationship may not be deleted in the process! The app has to return the already existing relationship!
* A CAR MODEL can only have **one** prime IMAGE, not multiple.
  * Creating a different relationship automatically deletes the previous relationship.

# Scope & Limits

* No authorization at the moment. Everyone can create the relationship.
* TBD: Can the prime image be every image? Does it have to come from the image gallery? Is it added automatically to the gallery, if not?
